faqs.q: What is the Lifecycle Impact Score (LIS)?
faqs.a: LIS is a single score that summarizes embodied energy and carbon across five phases: Origin→Production, Transport, Construction, Use/Maintenance, and End‑of‑Life. We weight phases and sum normalized impacts.
Paris % = 100 × (1 − Project_kgCO2e_per_m2 / Budget_kgCO2e_per_m2). We show the pathway, scope (A1–A5 or A–C), building type, and version in the PDF appendix.
A reference assembly set used for comparisons. We store it as YAML (climate zone, assemblies, quantities) and version it. Carbon Saved and Cost Savings are reported relative to BM2000.

faqs.q: Where do the data values come from?
faqs.a: The preview library uses illustrative sample values aligned to public sources (e.g., ICE/EPA/IPCC) for demo only. Production builds require licensed/verified datasets with source and date.
No. Maintenance for paints/finishes lives with finish assemblies (e.g., siding). Framing maintenance is ≈ none in our model.
